title: Top 10 Electric Cars with highest range in India
content: The top 10 electric cars with the highest range in India include models from Kia, BYD, Audi, BMW, Mercedes, and others. These vehicles offer impressive mileage on a single charge, ranging from 528 km to 677 km. With luxurious features and powerful electric motors, they cater to both performance enthusiasts and eco-conscious consumers seeking sustainable transportation options.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Rohit Kulkarni Mar 31, 2024 India is emerging in the global scene and making its mark on almost all spheres. In this story, we cover how the transportation and EV scene has changed in India. No longer in the nascent stage, the EV, its adoption as well as its infrastructure, all are catching up. With growing infrastructure, increased affordability and accessibility, increased fuel prices, EV has gained lot of acceptance in the buyers. One thing which still bothers them all, is the notorious range anxiety. We have prepared a list of EVs in the Indian market which have substantial range for a single charge and also claim to be one of the highest range EVs in India. Notably, the list of below cars have been done on the basis of WLTP cycle and hence it contains lot of premium EV cars. 10. Kia EV6 Priced between Rs 60.95 lakh-65.95 lakh and with a range of 528 kms on a single charge, the tenth one of our list is Kias flagship EV. Plonked with a 77.4kWh battery pack, it is available in a single-motor, rear- wheel-drive (RWD) guise making 229hp and 350Nm of torque, and in a dual-motor, all-wheel-drive (AWD) guise making 325hp and 605Nm. 9. Rolls Royce Spectre Priced at Rs 7.5 crore and with a range of 530 kms on a single charge, Rolls-Royces first-ever EV, Spectre, is the most expensive passenger electric vehicle on sale in India. Packed with a 102kWh battery pack, the battery can be charged from 10-80 percent in just 34 minutes using a 195kW charger. With a twin-motor setup, it has a total power output of 585hp and 900Nm, allowing the sprint from 0-100kph possible in mere 4.5 seconds. 8. Mercedes-Benz EQE SUV  550km Priced at Rs 1.39 crore and with a range of 550 kms on single charge, this 90.56kWh battery pack car comes with a dual-motor setup that generates 408hp and 858Nm, facilitating the acceleration from 0-100kph in just 4.9 seconds. 7. BYD Seal Priced between Rs 41 lakh-53 lakh, the car runs 570 kms on single charge. There are multiple powertrain and battery pack options with this beautiful beast. 6. Mercedes-AMG EQS 53 4Matic+ Priced at Rs 2.45 crore and with a range of 586 kms on a single charge, this powerful piece has a dual-electric motor setup that puts out 761hp in Race Start mode. Notably, once the boost function is activated, the car generates a maximum torque produced stands at 1020Nm. With a top speed of 250 kmph, the car can go from 0-100 kmph in mere 3.4 seconds. 5. BMW i4 With a range of 590km on single charge, this beauty is priced between Rs 73.90 lakh-77.50 lakh. Its motor produces 340hp and 430Nm, drawing power from an 83.9kWh lithium-ion battery pack that allows for a WLTP range of 590km. 4. Porsche Macan Turbo Priced at 1.65 crores and a range of 591km on a single charge, next in the ranks in the Macan Turbo by Porsche, which is built on the brands new PPE (Premium Platform Electric) platform. Powered by two electric motors that produce a total of 639hp. Notably, the same reaches up to 1,130Nm for short periods of over boost. The EV reaches 0-100kph in 3.3sec and has the top speed of 260 kmph. 3. Lotus Eletre & Audi Q8 e-tron sportback  600km WLTP The third best spot is occupied by two beasts from Lotus & Audi, one being Lotus Eletre price which is priced between Rs 2.55 crore-2.99 crore and another being the Audi Q8 e-tron price which is priced between Rs 1.14 crore-1.30 crore. With a 603hp dual-motor system, Lotus Eletre and Eletre S sprints to 100 kmph in a matter of 4.5 seconds. Packed with a 112kWh battery, it is claimed to give 600 kms range. On the other hand, Audi Q8 e-tron has a 114kWh battery and two electric motors that produce 340hp and 408hp in the 50 and 55 variants, respectively. 2. BMW i7 With a range of 625km, the Rs 1.95 crore EV by BMW, the car has a 101.7kWh lithium-ion battery that has a range between 591km-625km on the WLTP cycle. Alongwith its ICE sibling, the car has everything it takes to be the best of the best. 1. Mercedes-Benz EQS Clinching the top spot with a range of 677 kms on a single charge, is Mercedes-Benz EQS. Priced between Rs 1.55 crore-2.45 crore, the car is powered by a 107.8kWh battery with a dual motor set-up that produces 523hp and 855Nm. title: China may let self-driving cars kill people to win AI race: Khosla
content: Billionaire Vinod Khosla, speaking at SXSW event, said companies can't take risk of saying it's okay for self-driving cars to kill some people "as long as [the cars] are driving better". He added that a leading AI-related executive in China told him that the country may allow that to win the "self-driving car race". "It's sort of sad," Khosla said.

title: Why Did Tata Motors Partner with HPCL?
content: Tata Passenger Electric Mobility (TPEM) has partnered with Hindustan Petroleum Corporation (HPCL) to set up 5,000 public EV charging stations across India by the end of the year. Tata will utilize HPCL's extensive fuel station network and insights from over 1.2 lakh Tata EVs on Indian roads to strategically place chargers at locations frequently visited by Tata EV owners.

title: Launch of these 5 stunning SUVs confirmed in India
content: India anticipates an influx of new SUV launches, including Toyota's Taisor, Citroen's Basalt, Mahindra's XUV300 facelift, Hyundai's Alcazar facelift, and Tata's Curvv EV. From Toyota's compact SUV coupe to Tata's electric variant, the market is set to witness a range of vehicles catering to varying preferences and needs of Indian consumers.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 27, 2024 As per confirmed reports coming in, Indian automobile lovers will be soon able to buy these 5 SUVs, whose launch has been confirmed. Here are the those 5 much anticipated SUVs: Toyota is set to unveil the compact SUV coupe, Taisor, on April 3, ahead of its market launch. Positioned below the Hyryder, its a rebadged version of the Maruti Suzuki Fronx, offering minor updates while retaining the 1.0L turbo petrol and 1.2L NA petrol engines. Scheduled for a March 27 debut, the Citroen Basalt SUV coupe will hit Indian roads soon. Powered by a 1.2L turbo petrol engine, its based on the CMP platform and competes directly with the upcoming Curvv. Expected in the coming weeks, the facelifted XUV300 promises revisions inside and out. Drawing inspiration from Mahindras existing SUV range, itll feature new design elements and offer the 1.2L petrol and 1.5L diesel engines. Hyundais Alcazar facelift, arriving by mid-2024, boasts interior and exterior updates inspired by the updated Creta. Expect new features like Level 2 ADAS while retaining the 1.5L diesel and 1.5L turbo petrol engines. Tatas Curvv EV is set to hit dealerships by mid-2024, featuring a large battery pack for over 500 km range. Following its electric variant, the ICE sibling will arrive in the second half of the year, competing with Maruti Suzuki eVX and Hyundai Creta EV. title: Maruti Suzuki becomes 1st Indian automaker to cross ₹4 lakh cr m-cap
content: Maruti Suzuki India on Wednesday became the first Indian automaker to cross ₹4 lakh crore in market capitalisation. Shares of the company jumped to a 52-week-high of ₹12,724 during the session before closing at ₹12,550. It also became India's 19th listed company to cross the mark. Reliance Industries, TCS and HDFC Bank are among others who've achieved this milestone.
full_text: Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. became the first Indian automobile company to cross a market capitalisation of Rs 4 lakh crore as its shares touched an all-time high on Wednesday. The stock's market cap rose as much as Rs 14,800 crore during the session to cross that of Tata Motors Ltd., which had the highest market share earlier at Rs 3.54 lakh crore. Maruti Suzuki is well-positioned to capitalise on the SUV overdrive seen in the worlds third largest automotive market. The company sells the highest number of compact SUVs in the country, thanks to the demand for its Grand Vitara, Brezza and Fronx models. The company, clearly, has the highest market share among SUVs, but its Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd.the maker of Scorpio, Bolero and the Tharthat enjoys the highest revenue market share. With this, the stock ranks 14th among in terms of market cap in the Nifty total market, with Reliance Industries Ltd., Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. and HCL Technologies Ltd. leading. The stock rose as much as 3.85% during the day to Rs 12,722.70 apiece on the NSE. It was trading 3.2% higher at Rs 12,622 per share, compared to a 0.80% advance in the benchmark Nifty 50 as of 2 p.m. The share price has risen 52.2% on a year-to-date basis. The total traded volume so far in the day stood at 1.32 times its 30-day average. The relative strength index was at 75.56, indicating that the stock may be overbought.  Out of 50 analysts tracking the company, 41 have a 'buy' rating on the stock, six recommend 'hold' and three suggest 'sell', according to Bloomberg data. The average of 12-month analyst price targets implies a potential downside of 4%.

title: Stellantis calls mandatory work from home day, fires 400 employees on a call
content: Automaker Stellantis fired 400 employees on a call after telling them to work remotely on Friday. The employees were informed that the company would "hold important operational meetings that require specific attention and participation" and to ensure effective participation, a mandatory remote work day has been implemented. Stellantis said it took structural decisions to improve efficiency.
full_text: Italian-American automaker Stellantis has eliminated over 400 positions in its engineering, software and technology divisions in the US. It was the manner in which the layoffs were carried out that has raised eyebrows. According to Fortune magazine, Stellantis called for a mandatory remote work day on Friday, March 22. We will be holding important operational meetings that require specific attention and participation, the carmaker told employees in a notice on Thursday. To ensure everyone can effectively participate, the notice continued, we have decided to implement a mandatory remote work day. White collar workers who joined the remote call were told they were being laid off. It was a mass firing of everybody that was on the call, a mechanical engineer who was laid off during the call told Fox News. The engineer, who declined to be named, said that Stellantis is outsourcing jobs to India, Mexico and Brazil. So they continue to push low-cost countries that are more efficient for the company and more profitable, he said. The automaker -- which counts Jeep and Chrysler among its brands  told the Wall Street Journal that laid off workers have been offered a comprehensive separation package and transition assistance. As the auto industry continues to face unprecedented uncertainties and heightened competitive pressures around the world, Stellantis continues to make the appropriate structural decisions across the enterprise to improve efficiency and optimize our cost structure, it said in a statement. The Stellantis layoffs have once again put in spotlight the issue of layoffs etiquette. Over the last few months, the issue of how companies should inform their employees of bad news has been hotly discussed. In 2022, during Elon Musks takeover of Twitter, several employees discovered they had lost their jobs after being unable to log in to their work email. Later, Goldman Sachs also faced backlash for the way it conducted layoffs  the company emailed calendar invites for fake meetings at its New York headquarters, where employees were then informed that they were being laid off.

title: Which cars are preferred by India's top politicians?
content: PM Modi loves his Range Rover HSE (High Specification Equipment), which has replaced BMW 7 Series High-Security Edition due to features upgrade. While Amit Shah is usually seen in a Tata Safari, Nitin Gadkari loves to experiment with electric and hydrogen cars. Check which cars are loved by India's top politicians.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Rohit Kulkarni Mar 26, 2024 Lets find out which cars do Indias top politicians drive? Narendra Modi: Worlds most popular leader with an approval rating of 76 per cent, Narendra Modis carcade includes Range Rover HSE. HSE is an acronym for High Specification Equipment. One of the best luxury SUVs in the world, it is highly preferred by many influential people. Range Rover HSE has replaced the BMW which used to earlier chauffeur him. PM Modis car is fully armored and has 5-litre V8 engine that produces 375 hp of power. The car is equipped to deliver comfort and performance in all terrains due to its 44 drive system. Nitin Gadkari: When Indias first hydrogen fuel-cell powered vehicle, Toyota Mirai, was launched in India, it became the official ride of Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari. This car combines the hydrogen with oxygen from the outside air to generate power and creates no emissions. We have all been aware of Mr. Gadkaris openness to technology and this car is a statement into a future of possibilities. Amit Shah: Indias Home Minister, Amit Shah, prefers to travel in Tata Safari Dicor. This 2.2 litre diesel engine car is a robust one and is used by multiple politicians around the nation. Rahul Gandhi: The same car that finds its place in the present fleet of Amit Shah is also the car which is preferred by Congresss key politician. On multiple instances, Rahul Gandhi has been spotted in this car. MK Stalin: CM of Tamil Nadu, Muthuvel Karunanidhi Stalin, prefers to travel in Land Rover Defender, which is a popular and robust off road SUVs of the world. title: Xiaomi's 1st electric car costs more than Mercedes-Benz A-Class
content: Xiaomi's SU7 electric car, priced below 500,000 yuan or Rs 58 lakh will cost more than Mercedes-Benz A-Class in India, which is priced under Rs 50 lakh. SU7 is all set to rival Tesla and BYD with its advanced technology and competitive driving ranges. Check top features, range and more.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 25, 2024 Xiaomi, the Chinese electronics giant, is gearing up to launch its highly anticipated electric car, the SU7. Unveiled in December, Xiaomi aims to position itself as one of the top five automakers globally with this venture. The SU7 promises to be the best looking, easiest to drive, and smartest car in its segment. Price and Availability Xiaomis CEO has confirmed that the SU7 will be priced below 500,000 yuan (approximately $70,000 or Rs 58 lakh), making it an attractive option for electric vehicle enthusiasts. This announcement marks the first time Xiaomi has disclosed the upper end of the price range for the SU7. Official pricing details will be revealed on Thursday evening, with orders set to commence thereafter. Key Features and Comparisons The SU7 boasts cutting-edge technology capable of delivering acceleration on par with Tesla cars and Porsches EVs. Available in two versions, the car offers impressive driving ranges of up to 668km and 800km on a single charge, surpassing Teslas Model S, which has a range of up to 650km. Xiaomis EV Strategy Xiaomi has pledged a significant investment of $10 billion over a decade to solidify its presence in the electric vehicle market. As one of the few new entrants to gain approval from Chinese authorities, Xiaomis foray into EVs is backed by robust production capabilities. The companys cars are manufactured by a unit of the state-owned BAIC Group, utilizing a Beijing factory with an annual capacity of 200,000 vehicles. title: Chinese firms may flood domestic market amid India's EV push: GTRI
content: The Indian government's initiatives to boost domestic electric vehicle (EV) manufacturing may lead to large-scale entry of Chinese auto firms into the local market, think tank Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI) said in a report on Sunday. China's automotive industry, which has substantial government backing, is a leading exporter of EVs and related components, the report added.

title: Pay more for Kia Seltos, Sonet and Carens from April 1st
content: Kia India has announced a price hike of up to three percent for its vehicle models in response to escalating commodity prices and supply chain challenges. Despite the increase, the brand aims to mitigate the impact on consumers by absorbing a significant portion of the rise. Kia as a brand sold more than 11 lakh cars in India last year.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 25, 2024 Kia India has revealed plans to increase the prices of its vehicles across the board in India. The automaker has declared a price hike of up to three percent for its various models, effective from April 1, 2024. This move comes as a response to rising commodity prices and supply chain challenges, prompting the brand to adjust its pricing structure. Impacted Models Among the vehicles affected by the price hike are popular models like the Sonet, Seltos, Carens, and EV6. These vehicles cater to diverse segments of the market, offering customers a range of options to choose from. Notably, the Kia Sonet emerges as the most affordable option in the lineup, with prices starting at Rs 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom) and reaching up to Rs 14.69 lakh (ex-showroom). Reasoning Behind the Increase Hardeep Singh Brar, National Head of Sales and Marketing at Kia India, attributes the price hike to multiple factors including escalating commodity prices, rising input costs, and unfavorable exchange rates. Despite these challenges, Kia India aims to alleviate the impact on consumers by absorbing a significant portion of the increase. This strategy aims to ensure that customers can continue to enjoy Kia vehicles without experiencing a substantial financial burden. Impressive Sales Figures Since its inception, Kia India has achieved commendable sales figures, both in domestic and overseas markets. With a cumulative sales volume of nearly 1.16 million units, the brand has established a strong presence in the automotive industry. Notably, the Seltos model leads the pack with over 613,000 units sold, followed closely by the Sonet with over 395,000 units and the Carens with 159,000 units. Recent Sales Performance In the past month alone, Kia India reported a total sales figure of 20,200 units across its lineup. The Sonet emerged as the top-selling model, with 9,102 units sold, demonstrating its popularity among consumers. Following closely behind are the Seltos with 6,265 units and the Carens with 4,832 units sold. These figures underscore Kia Indias continued success and strong market presence. title: Goenka posts clips of tyre tests conducted 300km from Arctic Circle
content: CEAT Chairman Harsh Goenka shared clips showing the company's management team testing winter tyres 300 km north of the Arctic Circle. A video, shot at Ivalo in Finland, shows the tyres being tested "on external snow as well as an interior snow tunnel", Goenka said. One of the clips showed a car drifting at high speeds on the snow.

title: Maruti Suzuki buys 6.4% equity in AI startup Amlgo for ₹1.99 crore
content: Automobile major Maruti Suzuki invested ₹1.99 crore in AI and machine learning startup Amlgo Labs and will own 6.44% equity in it. "Our investment...will help us...strengthen quality of new models," Maruti Suzuki India CEO Hisashi Takeuchi said. "We're actively working to help strengthen the startup ecosystem and encourage innovation to develop solutions relevant to automobile industry," he said.

title: Kia India to hike vehicle prices by up to 3% from April 1
content: Kia India on Thursday announced it will hike the prices of its vehicles by up to 3% from April 1. The automaker cited a jump in commodity prices and supply chain-related inputs as reasons for the price hike. Maruti Suzuki, Audi, BMW and Honda Cars are among the other automakers that have increased vehicle prices in India this year.

title: EV battery trend: repair vs replace
content: Early EV adopters often repaired batteries cheaply at third-party workshops. However, newer EVs present challenges for repairs due to sealed batteries and lack of access to manufacturer data, pushing towards costly replacements. This shift contradicts EVs' sustainability ethos, raising concerns about increased costs and environmental impact. Repairing extends battery life and is more sustainable.
full_text: While early adopters are known to have repaired EV batteries at third-party workshops for a fraction of the cost, new users may find it harder to do so. When Mumbai-based Raphae Halim bought a Mahindra e2o electric car in 2013, he joined a niche of India?s earliest EV adopters. Nine years later his battery degraded to a point where he couldn?t drive it more than 10 km after a single charge. It was time to replace the battery pack. While Halim was prepared to replace the battery pack, with or without a warranty, he realised that he didn?t need to. ?By that time, the battery ecosystem in India had picked up,? he told The Core. It could be repaired at a cheaper cost, by replacing individual cells within the pack which had degraded. He also got the Mahindra and Mahindra workshop to run a diagnostic check on the car to ensure it was running well. Currently, a new battery pack costs anywhere between Rs 3.5 to Rs 8 lakhs for cars, as per estimates. Halim paid a total of Rs 75,000 to switch out three faulty cells from his pack. Halim, who was part of PluginIndia ? India?s first community of EV users ? is very clued in on developments in the EV space and experiments by other EV users. He also installed an active cell balancer, which reduces the chance of one individual cell degrading quicker than others, in the car. When Mumbai-based Raphae Halim bought a Mahindra e2o electric car in 2013, he joined a niche of Indias earliest EV adopters. Nine years later his battery degraded to a point where he couldnt drive it more than 10 km after a single charge. It was time to replace the battery pack. While Halim was prepared to replace the battery pack, with or without a warranty, he realised that he didnt need to. By that time, the battery ecosystem in India had picked up, he told The Core. It could be repaired at a cheaper cost, by replacing individual cells within the pack which had degraded. He also got the Mahindra and Mahindra workshop to run a diagnostic check on the car to ensure it was running well. Currently, a new battery pack costs anywhere between Rs 3.5 to Rs 8 lakhs for cars, as per estimates. Halim paid a total of Rs 75,000 to switch out three faulty cells from his pack. Halim, who was part of PluginIndia  Indias first community of EV users  is very clued in on developments in the EV space and experiments by other EV users. He also installed an active cell balancer, which reduces the chance of one individual cell degrading quicker than others, in the car. It has been around two years since Halim got his battery pack repaired. His car has had a range of about 90 km per charge. While this is not a permanent solution, it has significantly increased the life of his battery. Like Halim, several early adopters of electric two-wheelers, whose vehicles were past the warranty period, preferred to have their battery packs repaired rather than replaced. Alan, who runs an electric scooter service centre in Ernakulam, Kerala toldThe Core that his centre gets five to ten vehicles a month for battery repairs. Most of these, he said, come from scooters that have been in the market for longer than five years, like Okinawa, Benling, Kinetic Green and more. While users of vehicles aged five to ten years have the option of repairing their batteries, this may not be the case for those buying EVs today. Newer EV batteries are increasingly difficult to repair, with some being completely sealed. Third-party mechanics also dont have access to design or diagnostic data from manufacturers. This will not only increase costs for users but also contradict the fundamental purpose of EVs being sustainable. An electric vehicle, unlike an internal combustion engine vehicle, runs on a battery that doesnt last forever. With each charge and discharge cycle, the battery degrades a little. On average, the EV battery degrades about 1-2% each year, depending on usage patterns and charging habits. As the battery degrades, the vehicles range drops, eventually leading to the need for repair or replacement. Apart from general degradation and range issues, EV users sometimes need to fix faulty parts, like the battery management system (BMS). Currently, a battery pack makes up about half (or more) of the cost of an EV, making the prospect of replacing it a major anxiety for users. To alleviate this anxiety, several manufacturers in India offer extended warranties specifically for batteries. While Ather Energy offers an extended battery warranty of five years, Ola Electric announced an eight-year extended warranty in February. Tata Motors offers an eight-year or 1,60,000km (whichever is earlier) warranty on the battery and motor of its vehicles. At the moment, if a battery under warranty malfunctions, the company replaces the battery. Because of the extended warranty, and cost-free replacement, newer EV users are often opting to get their batteries replaced instead of repaired. Lithium-ion battery prices have been dropping faster than expected. According to Goldman Sachs, battery prices might fall by 40% by 2025, thanks to dropping prices of raw materials. It is still early days, and the technology is rapidly evolving. New vehicles have more sophisticated, better-quality battery packs, designed to last longer. So while there isnt a definitive answer to how long your battery will last, various studies peg it anywhere between 8-20 years. Early adopters were also luckier with repairs. Batteries of a Mahindra e2o, for instance, are simple enough to be opened and repaired. Technicians who work for the company service centres are equipped with the knowledge, and as more cars hit the second-hand market, spare parts became more readily available. For vehicles bought in the last four years, things are a little different. For one, they are still under the warranty period, and users prefer to take them to the authorised service centres. Alan, who runs his garage in Ernakulam, said that he had only worked on one Ola Electric battery, which had been damaged by rat bites and wasnt covered under warranty. The battery cost [to replace] was so expensive, the customer said I would rather purchase an ICE scooter for that much, he said. In many cases, a complete replacement of the pack may not be warranted, and replacing individual cells that have degraded, could increase the life and range of the battery. The question is, will this still be possible in the next ten years? The repair space currently is dominated by third-party workshops and centres. However, they do not have access to developing technology and R&D by OEMs. Getting their hands on spare parts of cells used by market leaders like Tata Motors in their battery packs is also very difficult since they arent made available in the open market, Anurag Sharma, CEO of EV service company India EV Garage explained. What is available is either cheaper Chinese cells or second-hand discards that garages might get their hands on. They also dont have access to diagnostic vehicle data, which could explain exactly what the issue is. Globally, repair shops have been fighting automakers for access to this data. In India too, this is a key drawback for independent service centres. Sharma and his team have worked on repairing batteries of various two-wheelers and Mahindra e20s, Mahindra Reva, and the older version of the Tata Tigor EV since 2021. They source cells either via Chinese imports or through second-hand or discarded batteries of older EVs. Globally, there is also a growing concern about batteries being made nearly impossible to repair. Teslas structural battery packs are made in a way that they are a part of the car, making it very hard to remove or repair them. Alan said that batteries by two-wheeler maker Pure EV are made with a silicon coating and are not repairable. While the company made headlines in 2021 for coming up with an AI-driven solution to automatically repair batteries, Alan said he has 25 unrepairable, unusable battery packs lying in his garage. People have just left them here, he said. For cars from companies like Tata Motors, battery packs are more complicated than earlier models used by Mahindra & Mahindra cars, Sharma said. They are made with updated safety measures  with coolants and temperature sensors and are sealed. We cant confirm the structure of these battery packs because they arent open sourceif someone doesnt have warranty and wants us to replace a module, it is possible but we need the cells from the company as well, he said. The Core reached out to Ather Energy, Tata Motors and Pure EV for comment but did not get a response. Many manufacturers across the world also activelydiscourage repairing batteries citing safety concerns. It is like repairing a bomb, Alan joked. Special insulated tools and equipment, plus expertise is needed to avoid injuries. A lithium-ion battery pack is essentially made up of several individual cells, connected and arranged in modules, put together along with a BMS. Weve earlier written in detail how a battery pack is assembled. When a battery pack is charged and discharged, all the cells dont degrade equally. Some might degrade way more quickly than others. Replacing these cells, with cells that better match the age and degradation of the rest of the pack, increases the life of the pack. Adding an active cell balancer, as Halim did, ensures that there isnt too much disparity in cell degradation. It is way cheaper to repair a battery than to replace it. Not only that, but it is also more sustainable. While a replaced battery pack lands up in a recycling facility, repairing a pack extends the process and also saves energy and resources that would go into making a new pack, and recycling the old one before its time. But with more batteries being replaced than repaired, the world will likely end up with more EV battery scrap, something it has already struggled to successfully dispose of. While a replaced battery pack lands up in a recycling facility, repairing a pack extends the process and also saves energy and resources that would go into making a new pack, and recycling the old one before its time. There are strict rules around lithium-ion battery waste disposal. According to Indias Battery Waste Management Rules from 2022, 90% of discarded materials must be recycled and recovered by 2026, with 20% going into new batteries by 2030. Battery recycling is a capital-intensive process, and recyclers currently struggle with logistical hurdles. One of the primary challenges we currently face is the collection of battery scrap. The unorganised nature of the market complicates the efficient retrieval of these valuable resources, Vikrant Singh, Co-Founder & CTO OF battery recycling company BatX Energies toldThe Core in an email response. Recyclers like BatX are currently focused on electronics scrap. From 2026 onwards, we anticipate a significant shift towards EV batteries, Singh said, adding that they also expect the industry to formalise soon. While early adopters are known to have repaired EV batteries at third-party workshops for a fraction of the cost, new users may find it harder to do so.

title: Citroen partners with BluSmart Mobility for 4,000 EV SUVs
content: French carmaker Citroen on Monday joined hands with Indian EV company BluSmart Mobility to expand the homegrown firm's all-electric fleet in the country.The French company and BluSmart Mobility have signed an MoU that secures the supply of 4,000 Citroen e-C3, all-electric compact SUV units, over a period of 12 months.

Join our Telegram Channel                                 https://t.me/InvestmentGuruIndiacom Download Telegram App before Joining the Channel French carmaker Citroen on Monday joined hands with Indian EV company BluSmart Mobility to expand the homegrown firm's all-electric fleet in the country. The French company and BluSmart Mobility have signed an MoU that secures the supply of 4,000 Citroen e-C3, all-electric compact SUV units, over a period of 12 months. As part of the initial phase, 125 Citroen e-C3 were flagged off from BluSmarts EV charging superhub in Bengaluru. The new Citroen compact SUV will augment BluSmarts growing fleet of over 7,000 EVs, the companies said in a statement. "This collaborative signifies a shared vision for a sustainable future in the realm of electric mobility, reaffirming our commitment to shaping a cleaner and greener transportation ecosystem," said Shishir Mishra, Brand Director, Citroen India. The Citroen e-C3 offers a range of 320 km and features fast-charging technology, capable of achieving full charge in less than an hour. "Having a shared vision of achieving net-zero mobility, 'with the mission to Decarbonise Mobility at Scale', we are dedicated to constructing a comprehensive EV mobility ecosystem in India, said Anmol Jaggi, Co-founder and CEO, BluSmart. BluSmart also owns and operates 4,400 EV chargers across its 36 superhubs spread across 1.5 million square feet in Delhi NCR and Bengaluru. title: Check Ford Endeavour's 4 variants in Australia
content: The release date of the new Ford Endeavour in India remains uncertain, but insights can be scooped out from its Australian variants. Competing with SUVs like the Skoda Kodiaq and Toyota Fortuner, the Endeavour offers four variants in Australia. The base Ambiente features a 2-liter twin-turbodiesel engine and advanced safety features. The Trend variant adds leather seats and upscale amenities.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Radhika Kajarekar Mar 19, 2024 The release date of the new Ford Endeavour in India remains unclear. However, examining the variations offered in the Australian market provides insights despite the uncertainties. If introduced, the competitors of the Endeavour will be some prominent SUVs like the Skoda Kodiaq and Toyota Fortuner. As of now, the car is available in the four variants in the Australian market. Lets take a look at some details about all of them! Ford Endeavours Four Variants: All You Need To Know! Base-spec Ambiente: The Ford Endeavour is powered by a 2-liter twin-turbodiesel engine generating 210 PS and 500 Nm of torque. It provides the option for 4WD, with rear-wheel drive as the default configuration. The car features fog lamps, DRLs, and LED headlights for enhanced visibility. Inside, it boasts an 8-inch digital drivers display and a 10.1-inch infotainment screen. Safety measures include ADAS and nine airbags, ensuring a secure driving experience. One-above base Trend The base variant boasts a powerplant comparable to its counterparts. Exclusive features include leather seats and 18-inch alloy wheels. Additionally, it offers a motorized tailgate and a 12-inch touchscreen system. Luxury floor mats and an eight-way powered drivers seat add to its upscale appeal. One-below top Sport The Ford Endeavour provides two powertrain options, one featuring a 3-liter V6 engine. It sports black exterior highlights and rides on 20-inch alloy wheels. Inside, all rows of the cabin are adorned with leather seats, and the sound system is state-of-the-art. The drivers seat boasts ten power settings and a memory feature for added comfort and convenience. Top-spec Platinum The Ford Endeavour features four-wheel drive and is powered by a 3-liter V6 engine. Additionally, it boasts a panoramic sunroof and matrix LED headlights. Inside, the luxurious cabin includes a Bang and Olufsen sound system and quilted leather seats. Other notable features comprise a 12.4-inch digital drivers display and park assist for enhanced convenience and comfort. If at all introduced, we can expect the price of the car to be around Rs 55 lakh to Rs 60 lakh. title: US billionaire dies after accidentally reversing Tesla into pond
content: A US billionaire Angela Chao has died after her Tesla Model X SUV fell into a pond on her private ranch in Johnson City. A Harvard graduate, Chao was chair and CEO of Foremost Group, an NYC-based international shipping company. Her death in a submerged Tesla car has raised questions about the safety of the electric vehicles.
full_text: Johnson City, March 18:Angela Chao,a 50-year-old American businesswoman and CEO of Foremost Group, died on February 11, 2024. Angela Chao died after her Tesla Model X SUV fell into a pond on her private ranch in Johnson City. Angela was a billionaire in the US whose death in a submerged car in water raised questions about the safety of the electric vehicles produced automobile companies.  According to Angela Chao's official account on X, she was chair and CEO of Foremost Group, an NYC-based international shipping company. She was a Harvard graduate. According to areportbyIndian Express,the death of a shipping tycoon due to a Tesla car falling into a pond drew safety issues in electric cars. The report further said that she died in the water as the water rushed inside her submerged car.Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal Buys Indias First Aston Martin DB12 Sportscar, Check Price Here.  Angela Chao Accident Video (Credit: Inside Edition):    TheIndian Expressreport said her friends and rescue personnel tried pulling her out. The report highlighted that after her death on February 11, more details have surfaced, raising questions about the safety of EVs and what to do when caught in such an accident. The report said that 50-year-old Angela Chao, daughter of James Si-Cheng Chao and wife of Ruth Mulan Chu Chao, was an immigrant who came to the US and founded the Foremost Group shipping company.  The report said that she was originally from China, and her older sister, Elaine Chao, is also an American businesswoman and former government official. Elaine served as US secretary of labour and administration of George W. Bush (2001-2009). On the weekend of February 9, the report mentioned that Angela Chao bid goodbye to her invited friends at her ranch in Austin, Texas, around 11:30 PM.Uber Pays USD 178 Million To End Long-Running Legal Fight With Australian Taxi Drivers and Hire Car Drivers.  Angela got into her car and went to her house, which was located on the same property. She called her friends a few minutes later to inform them about the accident caused by putting her Tesla in reverse instead of driving. The report said that for the next hour, many attempts were made to rescue her, and by the time officials reached there, her vehicle was full of water, and she was already dead. The report highlighted that the ranch's location delayed the arrival of the rescue workers, and no immediate drivers or long cable was available to reach her car. .  Latestly.com, 2024

title: Rs 10,000 discount on Electric Scooters under new Govt scheme
content: The Electric Mobility Promotion Scheme 2024, with a budget of Rs. 500 crore, offers Rs. 10,000 benefits for electric scooters, aiming to accelerate EV adoption amid the conclusion of the FAME II subsidy. Effective from April to July, it supports the electric vehicle ecosystem until future subsidy plans are determined. January witnessed 26% surge in sales of e-scooters.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 18, 2024 The Ministry of Heavy Industries introduces the Electric Mobility Promotion Scheme 2024 (EMPS), allocating Rs. 500 crore to promote electric vehicles. Of this, Rs. 333.39 crore is earmarked for electric two-wheelers, while the rest is allocated for electric three-wheelers. Rs. 10,000 Benefit for Electric Scooters Under the EMPS, each electric scooter will receive a benefit of Rs. 10,000, with a total of 3,33,387 units eligible for the scheme. Effective from April 1 to July 31, the scheme aims to boost electric vehicle sales across manufacturers, dealerships, and end buyers. As the FAME II subsidy concludes this month, the EMPS provides an interim support mechanism until further government decisions on electric vehicle subsidies. In January 2024, EV brands sold 81,343 electric two-wheeler units (26% YoY growth), followed by 81,963 units in February 2024 (24% YoY). The Electric Mobility Promotion Scheme (EMPS) could sustain this momentum in EV sales. April 2024 sales will determine its impact. In recent months, electric two-wheeler sales surged due to manufacturers offering cheaper models and various benefit schemes amid the removal of state subsidies, leading to price hikes. Additionally, concerns over the potential elimination of the Fame-II subsidy drove sales growth. The introduction of the Electric Mobility Promotion Scheme (EMPS) aims to bolster buyer confidence, as its criteria align with existing schemes. This eliminates the need for manufacturers to modify their products for EMPS eligibility. However, it remains unclear whether EV brands must recertify their offerings to comply with the new schemes standards. title: Man shares visuals of 1st ever Formula-4 car show held in Srinagar, PM Modi reacts
content: The first-ever Formula-4 car show was held on the banks of Dal Lake in Srinagar on Sunday to promote motorsports in Kashmir. PM Narendra Modi responded to a man who shared photos and videos from the event on X and said, "India offers great opportunities for motorsports to thrive and Srinagar is right on top of...places where it can happen!"

title: We'll put 100% tariffs on China firms' cars made in Mexico: Trump
content: Former US President Donald Trump, speaking at a rally in Ohio ahead of the US Presidential elections, said he'll put 100% tariffs on Chinese firms' cars made in Mexico. "If you're listening, [China] President Xi [Jinping], you're building monstrous car plants in Mexico...you're going to not hire Americans and you're going to sell the cars to us, no," Trump said.
full_text: Curated By: Kavya Mishra News18.com Last Updated: March 17, 2024, 08:11 IST Former US President Donald Trump stirred yet another controversy with his remarks when he vowed that the country will witness a bloodbath if he loses the Presidential elections this time. He further added that the US will not see another election if this is not won. The Republican leader was speaking at a rally in Ohio to seek support for his Republican Senate candidate Bernie Moreno, whom Trump endorsed in December. The former President made the contentious remark while speaking about thepossibility of an increasing trade war with China over auto manufacturing. If youre listening, President Xi, youre building monstrous car plants in Mexico right nowyoure going to not hire Americans and youre going to sell the cars to us, no. Were going to put a 100% tariff on every single car. Now if I dont get elected, its going to be a bloodbath for the whole thats gonna be the least of it," NBC quoted Trump as saying Its going to be a bloodbath for the country. That will be the least of it. But theyre not going to sell those cars. Theyre building massive factories. If this election isnt won, Im not sure that youll ever have another election in this country," he added. Meanwhile, Trumps campaign spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt attempted to defend the former President and said Joe Bidens policies on auto and manufacturing are creating an economic bloodbath for Americans. As a response to Trumps remark, President Joe Bidens team noted that former VP Mike Pence refused to endorse his former colleague, who continues to exhibit his extremism, affection for violence and thirst for revenge." This is who Donald Trump is: a loser who gets beat by over 7 million votes and then instead of appealing to a wider mainstream audience doubles down on his threats of political violence," James Singer, a spokesman for President Joe Bidens campaign told the publication. The decision makes Pence the latest in a series of senior Trump administration officials who have declined to endorse their former bosss bid to return to the Oval Office. title: BMW’s China-specific car criticised on national show over defects
content: BMW 530Li, which has been specifically designed for the Chinese market, was criticised at a show aired on World Consumer Rights Day every year in China. The show, broadcast on China Central Television, said consumers filed persistent complaints against abnormal sounds from the car's propeller shaft. It added that BMW hasn't provided satisfying solutions to the complaints.
full_text: (Bloomberg) -- BMW AG was named at an annual show airing consumer complaints about technical issues and shoddy services, just as legacy automakers fight intense competition from local rivals. The televised program  called the 315 Gala that runs on Worlds Consumer Rights Day every year  criticized the German automaker for technical defects on its BMW 530Li, according to the broadcast on China Central Television Friday. The premium sedan is specifically designed for the Chinese market. Consumers filed persistent complaints against abnormal sounds from the models propeller shaft, the broadcaster said. The company and local dealers didnt provide satisfying solutions to the issue which incurred both safety concerns and potential harm to the residential value of the car, it said. The name-and-shame show aims to uncover unfair company practices in a nation of 1.4 billion consumers and is closely watched by foreign companies. Besides being a public relations headache, the program has also sparked regulatory investigations and public apologies from executives in past years, including Apple Inc.s Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook and Jaguar Land Rovers parent, Tata Motors Ltd. BMW responded on its official Weibo account - the equivalent of X in China - that it has made technical checks on the reported issue to ensure it doesnt affect driving safety. The company is further analysing the problem to give a satisfying response to consumers, it said, and apologized for the inconvenience. While the 315 gala touts itself as a watchdog for consumer interests, its also seen as a yardstick for greater scrutiny or displeasure from the Chinese government. BMW sold almost 825,000 BMW and Mini vehicles in China last year, accounting for almost a third of global deliveries. Even as deliveries rose, international automakers including BMW are losing market share to local manufacturers such as BYD Co. The shows public impact has weakened in recent years with few major brands targeted. Younger Chinese consumers are also more likely to air their grievances on social media in real time, instead of relying on a once-a-year program. The key theme for this years show is to build integrity and safety, focusing on areas including food safety, finance security and online data fraud. More stories like this are available on bloomberg.com 2024 Bloomberg L.P.

title: India's new EV policy boosts Tesla's market entry plans
content: India on Friday said it will lower import taxes on certain electric vehicles for companies committing to at least $500 million in investment and a manufacturing facility within three years, potentially bolstering Tesla's market entry plans.India levies a tax of 70% or 100% on imported cars depending on their value.

title: Govt approves new EV policy, to lower import tax if companies invest ₹4,150 crore
content: Government has approved a policy to promote India as a manufacturing destination for electric vehicles. It requires companies to invest a minimum of ₹4,150 crore in India and set up local manufacturing units within three years. Companies meeting these requirements will be allowed limited import of EVs at a lower import duty of 15% on cars costing $35,000 and above.

title: ₹500-cr scheme to promote electric 2, 3-wheelers unveiled by govt
content: The Ministry of Heavy Industries has launched the Electric Mobility Promotion Scheme with a total outlay of ₹500 crore to promote the sale of electric two-wheelers and three-wheelers. The scheme will be implemented on April 1 and run till July 31. It will offer a subsidy of up to ₹10,000 per two-wheeler and up to ₹25,000 per light three-wheeler.
full_text: The central government on March 13 announced a new scheme of Rs 500 crore to promote sale of electric two and three wheelers. The Electric Mobility Promotion Scheme 2024 is for a special 4-month electric mobility promotion till July. The special new electric mobility promotion scheme will support electric 2-wheelers, 3-wheelers, e-rickshaws, said Ministry of Heavy Industries. "This commitment is made by the Ministry of Heavy Industries once again that we are committed to e- mobility and will continue to increase it at every level and will take the country to the forefront of green energy," the ministry stated. Breakdown of the scheme: 3.37 lakh electric two-wheelers. Incentive - Rs 5,000/KWH. Cap at Rs 10,000 41,306 electric three-wheelers. Incentive Rs 5,000/KWH. Capped at Rs 25.000 13,590 e-rickshaws. Incentive Rs 5,000/KWH. Cap at Rs 25,000 25,238 L5 electric three-wheelers. Incentive Rs 5,000/KWH.Cap at Rs 50,000. In February 2024, the government had raised the allocation under the second iteration of Faster Adoption & Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles in India (FAME-II) scheme to Rs 11,500 crore, up from Rs 10,000 crore. At present, Phase-II of the FAME India scheme is being implemented for a period of five years from April 1, 2019. It was set to expire on March 31, 2024. The FAME India scheme seeks to facilitate the uptake of EVs and chargers by subsidising them. The programme also aims to spur localisation of EV components while also driving sales up. Initiated in 2019, FAME II has so far provided subsidy on sales of nearly 1.2 million two-wheelers, 141,000 three-wheelers, and 16,991 four-wheelers. More than Rs 5,829 crore has been disbursed under the FAME II scheme.       Discover the latest business news, Sensex, and Nifty updates. title: Man Finds His Car Full of Baby Rats: How to Keep Your Car Safe
content: A concerning social media post has unveiled a severe Rat infestation in a car in India, spotlighting the risk rats pose to vehicles. Let us find out the practical measures to prevent and combat Rat presence in cars, emphasizing cleanliness, natural deterrents, and regular vehicle maintenance. Car owners are encouraged to remain vigilant.
full_text: A car owner in India found a shocking surprise in his car: a nest full of baby rats in the trunk, right where the spare tyre is kept. Going by his alias dev99_k, he shared a video on social media that got a lot of attention. The trunk was filled with shredded newspaper and other materials that the rats used to make their nest. Fortunately, the car wasnt badly damaged. Luckily no wire damages, only a seatbelt and wiper fluid cap was broken, the car owner said. This story shows how important it is to keep rats away from your car. The incident underscores a widespread problem faced by vehicle owners, where rodents such as rats, mice, and squirrels find their way into cars, leading to extensive and costly damages. These nimble creatures can infiltrate engines, vents, and cabins, gnawing on critical wires and tubing, which can compromise essential systems and pose serious health risks through the contamination of nesting materials. Here are several proactive measures car owners can adopt to safeguard their vehicles against Rat invasion: Look out for these signs that rats might be in your car: If rats are already in your car, you should act fast. Use some of the tips above to get rid of them. You might also need to clean your car well to get rid of any mess theyve made.

title: Drive the lightning: Maserati launches greyscale Folgore EV
content: Maserati is injecting energy into its lineup with the introduction of the 2024 Grecale Folgore, an electric iteration of its latest Grecale SUV. The name of the EV, 'Folgore', in Italian stands for Lightning. With the Horsepower under wrap, Folgore will generate up to 799.9 nm of torque. The Grecale Folgore is equipped with a substantial 105.0-kWh battery capacity.
full_text: By:  Juviraj Anchil | March 13, 2024 Maserati is injecting energy into its lineup with the introduction of the 2024 Grecale Folgore, an electric iteration of its latest Grecale SUV.  The name of the EV, 'Folgore', in Italian stands for Lightning.  With the Horsepower under wrap, Folgore will generate up to 799.9 nm of torque.  The Grecale Folgore is equipped with a substantial 105.0-kWh battery capacity.  The vehicle is estimated to give a range of 482.803 KM per charge.  The Folgore will take on the BMW iX and the Jaguar i-Pace.  The 2024 Maserati Folgore EV is estimated to be priced at Rs 62,17,083 lakh.  Thanks For Reading!

title: Tesla investors criticise lawyers' stock fee after Musk's pay cancelled
content: Tesla investors have written to a judge in US against lawyers who asked for the company's stock worth nearly $6 billion after succeeding in cancelling CEO Elon Musk's $55.8 billion pay package in January. "Elon Musk deserves the original compensation package in full," said one of the investors. The judge said she won't be reading the letters during litigation.

title: Gujarati Family Takes 1950 Vintage Car on a 13500 km Road Trip!
content: Gujarat's Daman Thakore and his family drove their classic 1950 MG YT on a 13,500 km road trip from Ahmedabad to London spanning 16 countries. To the urbane traveller, this would seem insane. But as Daman rightly points out, "Nothing about this trip was normal." Here's a look at their lifechanging journey in the 'Lal Pari'.
full_text: Gujarat's Daman Thakore and his family drove their classic 1950 MG YT on a 13,500 km road trip from Ahmedabad to London spanning 16 countries. Here's a look at their lifechanging journey in the 'Lal Pari'. Krystelle Dsouza What do you think was the first thing that an Ahmedabad-based businessman did when he decided to take a road trip? Well, he did what any of us would  put his start and stop locations in Google Maps. But heres the thing. The end location he put was London! And you can only imagine the result Google Maps rendered. 'Back To My Childhood': Kerala Man Turned a Barren Mining Site Into a Forest With Mud Homestays While many would rethink this brave feat around the globe, Daman Thakore was excited by the prospect. Driving through the breezy spring countryside or through the unforgivingly harsh,scorching deserts, this journey had been what this avid adventurer had dreamt of doing on his 50th birthday. And to simply have an adventure and do what few others have attempted before was alluring in its own way. Doing it with Lal Pari  a vintage UK-made 1950 MG YT manufactured 73 years ago, a part of his family since 1979  was the icing on the cake. In fact, as Daman interjects, the trip was a treat for Lal Pari (red fairy). The car was manufactured in a factory in Abingdon, UK, and we planned the trip with that as the final destination in mind. It was a sort of homecoming for her. Driving across continents is tough. But packing for the trip is a tougher feat. Damans instructions to his six companions were clear. Pack three sets of clothes and wear the fourth. But carry plenty of food. Planning a Monsoon Vacation? Enjoy The Rains At These 8 Homestays Across India To the urbane traveller, this would seem insane. But as Daman rightly points out, Nothing about this trip was normal. And so armed with the said duffle bags, and 80 kg of food, the family plodded from horizon to horizon. It took around 11 months of planning for the trip, and test drives around Gujarat to ensure Lal Pari was ready for the long ride that awaited. Fortunately, says Daman, driving licences werent a problem as hed already procured an international license prior to the trip that was valid across countries.Each country they entered had local road tax and insurance charges that they needed to pay.  A Couple's Search for Slow, Sustainable Life & A Wooden Cottage in The 'Queen of Hills' Finally, the journey across time was set to begin from Mumbai on the Indian Independence Day, 2023. Breaking down the route, Daman says, We left from Ahmedabad on 12 August. On 15 August we undertook the sea route from Mumbai to Dubai where we reached on 28 August. Once in Dubai, we hit the road and reached the UK on 26 October. In total, the journey took us 76 days. Putting their faith in the most feasible route suggested by Google Maps, they embarked on their trip. The Dubai to London route was what we settled on after exploring several different routes, including ones through Russia, Daman notes. Through the time spent in the two and a half months driving through 16 countries, Daman and his family have watched the world through a window, literally and metaphorically. Landscapes changed, time zones shifted, we watched it all in real-time, he says gazing off into the distance. And Im sure that he is mentally still in those lands he speaks of so fondly. But how much did this mind-boggling trip cost, you may ask? Roughly the cost of a Mercedes, Daman says cheekily. As a child, Daman never saw Lal Pari as a car. My mother would tell me these stories of how Lal Pari had superpowers and could come to save us whenever we needed. I grew up believing that. All my favourite memories have been in this car, Daman adds. These include trips to the zoo when he was younger, family trips when he was older, and eventually his marriage. So, it only seemed right that the car was his companion on this dreamy adventure. Navigating across the world on an impulse and high adrenaline means figuring out where your next lunch is going to be, hoping to find a petrol pump in a remote village where water is gold, and driving towards the next destination with hope, even when the road gets tough. But through it all, Lal Pari was very well-behaved. Before embarking on this daring tryst, only the carburettor was changed. Better fuel efficiency and more reliability, you see, he adds. Brothers' 17th Century Haveli Offers 200-YO Recipes, Jawai Leopard Trails & Village Walks The rest of the car, the engine, the gearbox, and the decor were preserved. Every dawn was a new village, every dusk a new countryside, and every day the family would pray to the weather gods to be kind and for any medical emergency to be averted. Of course, we had our fair share of bad weather, says Daman. But we improvised. He recalls the early days of the trip when the weather was warm and half-sleeve t-shirts were the norm for the group. But as we drove through Turkey, Greece, Bulgaria, Macedonia, Montenegro, Albania, Slovenia and Croatia, it began getting cold. When we reached Switzerland, France, Italy and the UK, it was raining! So, what did the family do? We wore our raincoats and continued driving, laughs Daman. We knew it wasnt going to be sunshine and rainbows all the time, he adds. And so the family of seven, Daman, his wife, his 75-year-old father, his 21-year-old daughter, a photographer friend, and an uncle, drove to the edge of the world with a support vehicle behind that held the luggage. Uncertainty seemed to be the theme of every day. But no one was complaining. Recalling a nerve-wracking episode they had when they crossed the Turkey border, Daman shares how they were set to reach their pre-booked stay in the morning, but reached at 3:30 am. The designated guy wasnt answering. We couldnt manage to book any new place. So, we drove around in the car until we managed to find somewhere to stay! A gamble with fate is what the trip was. Throughout the journey, the only thing we were sure about was our direction, Daman adds. But even in the face of changing climes and uncertain destinations, Daman says the incredible love they received from people served as their compass. Peoples fondness for India shone through, Daman recalls when Mr Omidvar (a gentleman they met in Tehran) sang the Indian national anthem  which he had learnt on his trip to India in 1953  to perfection. The group recalls watching with goosebumps. Daman was fascinated when he told the group about his own expedition in 1953 where he rode around the world on a motorbike. Here I was with gadgets, Google Maps, a phone, technology and the latest roads. But this man had done it at a time when none of this existed, he says. The love for India only became more evident as the group neared their destination. In Bulgaria, we stopped for engine oil at a small village which is home to one of the most orthodox churches in the world. A woman in her fifties asked us to accept the fuel for free. The fact that we were Indians got us this favour. As the woman explained, her love for India had led her to memorise the Bhagwad Gita and the Ramayana. She was well-versed in Sanskrit and was a fan of Amitabh Bachchan and Shah Rukh Khan. And youll be surprised to know she had never been to India, emphasises Daman. The country has goodwill across the world, he adds. And kindness never left the familys side. When in the UK, Daman recounts how a man named Anil helped him through a sticky spot. My car had broken down and it was very expensive to hire a pickup truck there. I had visited Anil for a few car-related things the previous day and as soon as the car broke down, I asked him if he could send someone to help. Not only did Anil drive 600 miles to help but did not charge a penny for it. Yesterday when you drove Lal Pari to my garage, you brought a smile to my sons face. I cannot charge you, was Anils excuse. But whats more fascinating is the number of people Daman met through this incredible journey that they undertook  fifty thousand people and counting! And when he finally reached the destination, the exhilaration was visible. In fact, the start of the journey was equally emotional. It was something Id been dreaming of for the longest time and to get out in Dubai and onto the road was amazing, he says. It was during the documentation process and obtaining a carnet de passage (passport for the car that enables it to travel across countries) that they learnt that they were one of the first Indians to undertake an expedition of this kind. Doing the trip with my family added to the magic, Daman says. There was so much joy when we accomplished it, and a feeling of gratitude to be able to do what many may have dreamt of. That being said, he adds that the magic of travel evokes a unanimous feeling. It is ingrained in our DNA. Whether it was Vasco da Gama exploring the world, or you and I, travel is intrinsic to our existence, he adds. Today, Lal Pari is back in Damans garage in their Ahmedabad home after the long and telling adventure shes been on. I dont know if its just my imagination but it seems like Lal Pari is shining a little bit brighter, ready for the next exciting adventure. (Edited by Padmashree Pande; All photo credits are attributed to Vinay Panjwani) editorial@thebetterindia.com contact@thebetterindia.com right here!

title: Top 5 new features of Rs 16.8 lakh worth Hyundai Creta N Line
content: Hyundai launches the Creta N Line, featuring sporty design elements and enhanced performance with a 1.5-liter turbo-petrol engine. Red accents adorn the exterior, while the cabin boasts a sporty interior with leatherette seats and red stitching. The SUV offers dynamic driving experience with refined suspension and steering. Bookings are now open.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 12, 2024 Hyundai Motor India has introduced the Creta N Line, a dynamic addition to its SUV lineup, featuring a host of sporty design elements that set it apart from the standard model. The N Line variant boasts a redesigned grille, sharper front and rear bumpers, and distinctive 18-inch dual-tone alloy wheels. Red accents adorn the exterior, including the brake calipers, N Line badging, and subtle touches throughout the vehicles bodywork. Inside, the cabin receives a sportier treatment with a three-spoke steering wheel, leatherette seat upholstery featuring red stitching, and matching accents on the gear knob. Enhanced Performance and Handling Under the hood, the Hyundai Creta N Line packs a punch with its 1.5-liter turbo-petrol engine, delivering an impressive 160 horsepower and 253 Nm of torque. Drivers have the option of choosing between a six-speed manual transmission or a seven-speed DCT gearbox. The SUVs suspension has been meticulously tuned to elevate its handling capabilities, ensuring a dynamic driving experience on various road conditions. Refinements to the steering system provide drivers with enhanced precision and responsiveness, allowing for greater control and confidence behind the wheel. Louder Exhaust and Dynamic Driving Experience One of the standout features of the Hyundai Creta N Line is its exhilarating exhaust note, which exudes a sporty and dynamic character. Equipped with a dual-tip exhaust system, the Creta N Line emits a throatier sound that resonates with enthusiasts seeking an immersive driving experience. Whether navigating city streets or embarking on exhilarating adventures, the Creta N Line delivers a symphony of engine notes that enhance the overall driving pleasure. N Line Heritage and Legacy Joining the esteemed lineup of Hyundai N Line models, including the i20 N Line and Venue N Line, the Creta N Line embodies the spirit of performance and innovation. Drawing inspiration from Hyundais motorsport heritage, the N Line variants combine cutting-edge technology with striking design elements to create an unparalleled driving experience. With a focus on agility, power, and style, the Creta N Line represents the pinnacle of Hyundais engineering prowess and commitment to pushing the boundaries of automotive excellence. Booking and Availability Enthusiasts eager to experience the thrill of driving the Hyundai Creta N Line can now book their preferred variant for a nominal token amount of Rs 25,000. With two variants to choose from, namely N8 and N10, customers have the flexibility to select the model that best suits their preferences and driving style. As Hyundai continues to redefine the SUV segment with its innovative offerings, the Creta N Line stands out as a testament to the brands commitment to delivering unparalleled performance and style to discerning drivers. title: BYD's Rs 2 crore E-supercar challenges Ferrari, Lamborghini
content: BYDh has introduced Yangwang U9, its debut supercar challenging industry titans like Ferrari and Lamborghini. Priced at approximately Rs 2 crore, this electric marvel boasts a formidable powertrain with four motors delivering a combined peak power of 960 kW. Equipped with cutting-edge Blade Battery technology and dual charging capabilities, the Yangwang U9 redefines performance.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 11, 2024 In a groundbreaking move, China-based electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer BYD Auto has unleashed its inaugural supercar, the Yangwang U9, poised to rival the likes of Ferrari and Lamborghini. Priced at approximately 2 crore (1.68 million Yuan), this cutting-edge model represents a significant milestone for BYD as it ventures into the high-performance automobile segment. Trailblazing Design and Performance Wang Chuanfu, founder, chairman, and CEO of BYD, envisions the Yangwang U9 as a trailblazer in the automotive realm, promising an unparalleled driving experience characterized by safety, performance, and customer satisfaction. With a focus on innovation and engineering excellence, this supercar is set to redefine the boundaries of electric vehicle technology. Price and Powertrain Positioned competitively against established supercar icons, the Yangwang U9 boasts a formidable powertrain comprising four electric motors, each delivering a peak power of 240 kW, culminating in a combined peak power of 960 kW. This engineering marvel enables the Yangwang U9 to achieve remarkable feats, including a top speed of 309.19 kmph and an astonishing acceleration from 0 to 100 kmph in just 2.36 seconds. Technological Marvels The Yangwang U9 is not only a powerhouse of performance but also a showcase of cutting-edge technology. Equipped with BYDs proprietary Blade Battery technology, it offers enhanced cooling and ultra-fast charging capabilities of up to 500 kW, ensuring optimal efficiency and convenience for EV enthusiasts. Moreover, the inclusion of dual charging technology facilitates rapid charging, with the ability to boost charge from 30% to 80% in a mere 10 minutes. Furthermore, the Yangwang U9 incorporates advanced features such as independent wheel control for enhanced stability and safety, along with a suite of aerodynamic packages designed to minimize drag coefficient and optimize heat dissipation efficiency. These technological innovations underscore BYDs commitment to pushing the boundaries of automotive engineering and delivering unparalleled driving experiences. With plans to debut the Yangwang U9 in China before expanding its presence in global markets, BYD is poised to disrupt the supercar landscape, offering discerning customers a compelling blend of performance, innovation, and sustainability. As the automotive industry embraces the electrification revolution, the Yangwang U9 stands as a testament to BYDs pioneering spirit and unwavering dedication to shaping the future of mobility. title: 10% lifetime tax on electric cars above Rs 25 lakh in Bengaluru
content: Karnataka introduces new taxation rules impacting transport vehicles & electric vehicles. With a 3% additional cess on newly registered transport vehicles, the state aims to support social security measures. Additionally, EVs costing over Rs 25 lakh will now face a 10% lifetime tax. These changes signal a shift in Karnataka's vehicle taxation policy, affecting both transport operators and EV.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 10, 2024 The Karnataka Motor Vehicle Taxation (Amendment) Act, 2024, recently signed into law by Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot, introduces significant changes in vehicle taxation.  Under the new legislation, a 3% additional cess will be imposed on newly registered transport vehicles, including taxis, buses, and auto-rickshaws. This move aims to fund the Karnataka Motor Transport and Other Allied Workers Social Security and Welfare Fund. Lifetime Tax on Electric Vehicles (EVs) Another notable provision of the amendment empowers the state government to levy a lifetime tax on electric vehicles (EVs) costing over Rs 25 lakh. These EVs, such as motor cars, jeeps, omnibuses, and private service vehicles running on electricity, will incur a tax of 10% of the vehicles cost at the time of registration. While Karnataka initially exempted EVs from road taxes in 2016, this amendment marks a shift in policy. As per data, Karnataka impose highest road tax in India, which goes up to 20% in some cases. An official said, At present, we are imposing 11% cess, including 10% infrastructure cess and 1% urban transport cess. title: This is why electric bike taxis are banned in Bengaluru
content: Find out how Karnataka has banned all Electric bike taxis in the state. Despite efforts to regulate the sector, challenges exists, leading to the withdrawal of the Electric Bike Taxi Scheme. However, this decision contrasts with a recent advisory from the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways supporting bike taxis.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 10, 2024 The withdrawal of the Electric Bike Taxi Scheme by the Karnataka government has sparked debate and raised concerns about the future of eco-friendly transportation solutions in the state. Launched in 2021 with the aim of enhancing first and last-mile connectivity and generating employment opportunities, the scheme faced opposition from auto-rickshaw unions in Bengaluru. Why Ban? The decision to ban electric bike taxis stems from various factors highlighted in a notification issued by the state transport department. Concerns were raised about private app-based organizations utilizing non-transport two-wheelers in violation of the Motor Vehicle Act. Instances of heated disputes between auto and taxi drivers and bike taxi riders led to law and order issues, raising significant concerns about womens safety. Additionally, the unauthorized operation of bike taxis has impacted the tax collection and enforcement efforts of the transport department. Auto Unions Objected Sources indicate that opposition from auto-rickshaw unions played a significant role in influencing the governments decision. Persistent demands for a ban on bike taxis and instances of intimidation against bike taxi riders further fueled the controversy. Despite efforts to regulate the sector, including granting licenses to certain operators, challenges persisted, with some aggregators operating without approval. In contrast to the state governments decision, a recent advisory from the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) supports the concept of bike taxis. The advisory encourages states and union territories to accept and process applications for contract carriage permits for motorcycles under the provisions of the Motor Vehicles Act and its rules. While the Electric Bike Taxi Scheme was introduced with noble intentions, challenges related to regulatory compliance, safety concerns, and opposition from vested interests have led to its withdrawal. The ban on electric bike taxis in Karnataka underscores the complex dynamics and competing interests in the transportation sector, highlighting the need for a balanced approach that prioritizes both innovation and regulatory oversight. title: Electric cars 1850-times more polluting than petrol/diesel cars
content: A recent study by Emission Analytics reveals that electric vehicles (EVs) emit 1,850 times more particulate matter from brakes and tires compared to gas-powered cars due to heavier batteries. Despite EVs' environmental benefits, the report highlights concerns about faster deterioration and chemical release from battery wear.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Mohul Ghosh Mar 10, 2024 As per a recent study by Emission Analytics, the batteries of electric vehicles are heavier than petrol engines which in turn puts more weight on brakes and tyres which further releases more particulate matter from brakes and tyres as compared to modern gas-powered counterparts. As per the study, the particulate matter emission could be 1,850 times greater. EVs cause 1850 times Particulate Matter Emission Immense interest has been generated in the environment-friendly transportation choices and it is a widely accepted notion that the EVs are better for the environment than petrol and diesel cars due to the fact that they produce lesser greenhouse gases. The report says that the heavier batteries cause the EV to deteriorate faster by accelerating wear and tear and then release harmful chemicals into air, what makes the scenario all the more precarious is that most of the tyres are made up of synthetic rubber which in turn is derived from crude oil. Global Electric Vehicle Adoption Outlook Reports cited the example of Tesla Model Y and the Ford F-150 Lightning which have batteries that weigh around 1,800 pounds. As per the study, the tyre wear emissions from an electric car with half ton battery is 400 times than its petrol counterpart. As per the Bloomberg, Uber has planned that by 2030, all its vehicles in US, Canada & European cities shall be 100% electric. Dara Khosrowshahi, CEO of Uber said that The stark reality is that Uber will not reach our zero-emission goals without stronger action from policymakers and businesses. Unfortunately, right at the moment we need to accelerate through the turn, many governments and automakers are slowing down, he added. title: MG Motors beat Maruti, Tata, Hyundai in monthly growth rate (Feb)
content: In February, Maruti retained its position as the top-selling Indian car brand, with 1.60 lakh units sold, outperforming Tata, Hyundai, and Mahindra. But in terms of growth, there is a big surprise: MG Motors has raced ahead of Tata, Maruti, Hyundai with 18% growth, month on month. Renault saw a 38% YoY decline but a 7% MoM growth.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Rohit Kulkarni Mar 10, 2024 In the month of February 2024, Maruti retained its top spot of being the best-selling Indian car brand. Second in the list is Tata, which beat Hyundai to clinch second spot. Other than Mahindra, MG, and Renault, all other brands have experienced have seen a dip in sales. February 2024 Auto Sales Report With 1.60 lacs units sold in month of February, Maruti Suzuki retained the top spot. Notably, this is more than the combined sales of other rival which include Tata, Hyundai & Mahindra. While the brand grew 9% YoY, it saw a MoM decline of 4%. With a 20% YoY growth, Hyundai sold more than 50 thousand cars in the month of February 2024. Notably, it also saw a 12% MoM decline. Mahindra registered a massive 40% YoY increase in car sales and sold 42,000 SUVs in February. It also saw a decline of 1.5%. Clinching the 5th spot, Toyota overtook Kia and sold 23,000-odd units last month and despite a minor dip in MoM sales, it saw massive 53% YoY growth. Mixed Performance Among Major Automakers Kia saw a 15% MoM decline in February 2024 and 18% YoY decline and sold 20,000 cars in the month of February. With a 17.5 % YoY rise in 2024, Honda saw a decrease of 1500 units in February as compared to January. The only automaker to witness positive MoM and YoY sales in February 2024 is 18.5% and 8% respectively and sold more than 4,500 in February 2024. Renault saw a 38% decline YoY and registered a MoM growth of 7% with 4000 units sales. Last in the list is Volkswagen with 3000 units of car sales with MoM and YoY being 7.5% and 9% respectively. title: Bajaj will launch World's 1st CNG bike, price may start Rs 40,000
content: Bajaj Auto's MD Rajiv Bajaj has revealed plans to launch the world's first CNG motorcycle in the upcoming quarter, aiming to significantly reduce fuel costs by 50-60% compared to traditional ICE counterparts. The CNG model also boasts lower emission levels, with reductions of 50% in CO2 and up to 90% in other harmful emissions.
full_text: Saturday, July 6, 2024 Rohit Kulkarni Mar 09, 2024 Bajaj Autos MD Rajiv Bajaj announced that the worlds first CNG bike shall be launched in the next quarter. Bajajs CNG Motorcycle In an interview, he said that Bajaj CNG motorcycle could do what Hero Honda did and that is to halve the cost of the fuel. He also added that there is reduction of 50-60% in the fuel costs as well as operating costs. Not just that, but when compared to the ICE counterparts, CNG model has lower emission levels as well. There has been a reduction of 50% in CO2 in the CNG prototype, reduction of 75% & 90% in Carbon monoxide and non-methane hydrocarbon emissions. As per earlier reports, the CNG bike from Bajaj can be priced between Rs 40,000 and Rs 60,000. But more details are awaited. The Biggest Pulsar & Segmentation Over Premiumization Additionally, the company said that early in financial year 2025, it is all set to launch the biggest Pulsar ever and the firm said that it is firing all cylinders and focussing on super segmentation for brands like Pulsar instead of premiumisation. Bajaj said that it is the 125cc Plus segment, that continues to be the focus of Bajaj and the same is evident from companys product launches almost every fortnight.
